member.name: T:FluentUI.Demo.Shared.ReflectionExtensions
member.summary: Reflection extension methods with supporting properties.

member.name: P:FluentUI.Demo.Shared.ReflectionExtensions.KnownTypeNames
member.summary: A dictionary containing a mapping of type to type names.

member.name: M:FluentUI.Demo.Shared.ReflectionExtensions.CreateKnownTypeNamesDictionary
member.summary: Create a dictionary of standard value types and a string type.
member.returns: Dictionary mapping types to type names

member.name: M:FluentUI.Demo.Shared.ReflectionExtensions.IsNullable(System.Type)
member.summary: Checks if the specified type is a nullable value type. Returns false for object references.
member.param: Type to check.
member.returns: True if the type is nullable like int? or Nullable<Something>

member.name: M:FluentUI.Demo.Shared.ReflectionExtensions.ToNameString(System.Type,System.Func{System.Type,System.String})
member.summary:
Convert type to the proper type name. Optional function can convert type names to strings if type names should be decorated in some way either by converting text to markdown or HTML links or adding some formatting.
This method returns ValueTuple types without field names.
member.param: Type information.
The optional function that converts type name to string.

member.name: M:FluentUI.Demo.Shared.ReflectionExtensions.ToNameString(System.Type,System.Func{System.Type,System.Collections.Generic.Queue{System.String},System.String},System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Convert type to the proper type name. Optional function can convert type names to strings if type names should be decorated in some way either by converting text to markdown or HTML links or adding some formatting.
This method returns ValueTuple types without field names.
member.param: Type information.
The optional function that converts type name to string.

True if typeNameConverter lambda function should be invoked for generic type name such as for the List name in case of List<SomeType> If the parameter value is false then typeNameConverter is not invoked for the generic type name and only the plain type name is returned. If the parameter value is true then typeNameConverter must handle generic type definitions carefully and avoid calling ToNameString() to avoid infinite recursion. This is an optional parameter with default value of false.

member.name: M:FluentUI.Demo.Shared.ReflectionExtensions.ToParametersString(System.Reflection.MethodBase,System.Func{System.Type,System.Collections.Generic.Queue{System.String},System.String},System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Convert method parameters to the string. If method has no parameters then returned string is () If parameters are present then returned string contains parameter names with their type names. Optional function can convert type names to strings if type names should be decorated in some way either by converting text to markdown or HTML links or adding some formatting.
This method returns ValueTuple types with field names like this (Type1 name1, Type2 name2).
member.param: Method information
The optional function that converts type name to string.

True if typeNameConverter lambda function should be invoked for generic type name such as for the List name in case of List<SomeType> If the parameter value is false then typeNameConverter is not invoked for the generic type name and only the plain type name is returned. If the parameter value is true then typeNameConverter must handle generic type definitions carefully and avoid calling ToNameString() to avoid infinite recursion. This is an optional parameter with default value of false.
member.returns: Full list of parameter types and their names

member.name: M:FluentUI.Demo.Shared.ReflectionExtensions.ToTypeNameString(System.Reflection.ParameterInfo,System.Func{System.Type,System.Collections.Generic.Queue{System.String},System.String},System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Convert method parameter type to the string. Optional function can convert type names to strings if type names should be decorated in some way either by converting text to markdown or HTML links or adding some formatting.
This method returns ValueTuple types with field names like this (Type1 name1, Type2 name2).
member.param: Parameter information.
The optional function that converts type name to string.

True if typeNameConverter lambda function should be invoked for generic type name such as for the List name in case of List<SomeType> If the parameter value is false then typeNameConverter is not invoked for the generic type name and only the plain type name is returned. If the parameter value is true then typeNameConverter must handle generic type definitions carefully and avoid calling ToNameString() to avoid infinite recursion. This is an optional parameter with default value of false.
member.returns: Full type name of the parameter

member.name: M:FluentUI.Demo.Shared.ReflectionExtensions.ToTypeNameString(System.Reflection.MethodInfo,System.Func{System.Type,System.Collections.Generic.Queue{System.String},System.String},System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Convert method return value type to the string. Optional function can convert type names to strings if type names should be decorated in some way either by converting text to markdown or HTML links or adding some formatting.
This method returns ValueTuple types with field names like this (Type1 name1, Type2 name2).
member.param: Method information.
The optional function that converts type name to string.

True if typeNameConverter lambda function should be invoked for generic type name such as for the List name in case of List<SomeType> If the parameter value is false then typeNameConverter is not invoked for the generic type name and only the plain type name is returned. If the parameter value is true then typeNameConverter must handle generic type definitions carefully and avoid calling ToNameString() to avoid infinite recursion. This is an optional parameter with default value of false.
member.returns: Full type name of the return value

member.name: M:FluentUI.Demo.Shared.ReflectionExtensions.ToTypeNameString(System.Reflection.PropertyInfo,System.Func{System.Type,System.Collections.Generic.Queue{System.String},System.String},System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Convert property type to the string. Optional function can convert type names to strings if type names should be decorated in some way either by converting text to markdown or HTML links or adding some formatting.
This method returns ValueTuple types with field names like this (Type1 name1, Type2 name2).
member.param: Property information.
The optional function that converts type name to string.

True if typeNameConverter lambda function should be invoked for generic type name such as for the List name in case of List<SomeType> If the parameter value is false then typeNameConverter is not invoked for the generic type name and only the plain type name is returned. If the parameter value is true then typeNameConverter must handle generic type definitions carefully and avoid calling ToNameString() to avoid infinite recursion. This is an optional parameter with default value of false.
member.returns: Full type name of the property

member.name: M:FluentUI.Demo.Shared.ReflectionExtensions.ToTypeNameString(System.Reflection.FieldInfo,System.Func{System.Type,System.Collections.Generic.Queue{System.String},System.String},System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Convert field type to the string. Optional function can convert type names to strings if type names should be decorated in some way either by converting text to markdown or HTML links or adding some formatting.
This method returns ValueTuple types with field names like this (Type1 name1, Type2 name2).
member.param: Field information.
The optional function that converts type name to string.

True if typeNameConverter lambda function should be invoked for generic type name such as for the List name in case of List<SomeType> If the parameter value is false then typeNameConverter is not invoked for the generic type name and only the plain type name is returned. If the parameter value is true then typeNameConverter must handle generic type definitions carefully and avoid calling ToNameString() to avoid infinite recursion. This is an optional parameter with default value of false.
member.returns: Full type name of the field

member.name: M:FluentUI.Demo.Shared.ReflectionExtensions.ToNameStringWithValueTupleNames(System.Type,System.Collections.Generic.IList{System.String},System.Func{System.Type,System.Collections.Generic.Queue{System.String},System.String},System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Convert type to the string. Optional function can convert type names to strings if type names should be decorated in some way either by converting text to markdown or HTML links or adding some formatting.
This method returns ValueTuple types with field names like this (Type1 name1, Type2 name2).
member.param: The names of the tuple fields from compiler-generated TupleElementNames attribute
The optional function that converts type name to string.

True if typeNameConverter lambda function should be invoked for generic type name such as for the List name in case of List<SomeType> If the parameter value is false then typeNameConverter is not invoked for the generic type name and only the plain type name is returned. If the parameter value is true then typeNameConverter must handle generic type definitions carefully and avoid calling ToNameString() to avoid infinite recursion. This is an optional parameter with default value of false.
member.returns: Full name of the specified type

member.name: M:FluentUI.Demo.Shared.ReflectionExtensions.ToNameString(System.Type,System.Collections.Generic.Queue{System.String},System.Func{System.Type,System.Collections.Generic.Queue{System.String},System.String},System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Convert type to the proper type name. Optional function can convert type names to strings if type names should be decorated in some way either by converting text to markdown or HTML links or adding some formatting.
This method returns named tuples with field names like this (Type1 field1, Type2 field2). parameter must be specified with all tuple field names stored in the same order as they are in compiler-generated TupleElementNames attribute. If you do not know what it is then the better and easier way is to use ToTypeNameString() methods that retrieve field names from attributes.
member.param: The names of value tuple fields as stored in TupleElementNames attribute. This queue is modified during call.
The optional function that converts type name to string.

True if typeNameConverter lambda function should be invoked for generic type name such as for the List name in case of List<SomeType> If the parameter value is false then typeNameConverter is not invoked for the generic type name and only the plain type name is returned. If the parameter value is true then typeNameConverter must handle generic type definitions carefully and avoid calling ToNameString() to avoid infinite recursion. This is an optional parameter with default value of false.

member.name: F:FluentUI.Demo.Shared.ReflectionExtensions.GenericTuples
member.summary: Hash of all possible ValueTuple type definitions for quick check if type is value tuple.

member.name: M:FluentUI.Demo.Shared.ReflectionExtensions.CleanGenericTypeName(System.String)
member.summary: Remove the parameter count part of the generic type name. For example the generic list type name is List`1. This method leaves only the name part of the type such as List. If specified string does not contain the number of parameters part then the same string is returned.
member.param: Type name
member.returns: Type name without the number of parameters.
